com.uk.tsl.rfid

Class WeakHandler<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.os.Handler
      • com.uk.tsl.rfid.WeakHandler<T>

  • public abstract class WeakHandler<T>
extends android.os.Handler
    A handler implementation that stores a weak reference to an object and only calls #handleMessage(Message, T) on subclasses when the reference to the object is not lost yet.

    Basically this enables us to create static handler classes while still be able to call through to the activity or context and store a reference to the handler as a normal class member.

    Example for activity MyActivity: 

     private static class MyHandler extends WeakHandler<MyActivity> {
   public MyHandler(MyActivity t) {
     super(t);
   }
  
   @Override
   public handleMessage(Message msg, MyActivity t) {
     // handle message normally here...
   }
  
 }
    Based on code taken from here http://pastebin.com/vCLY57Ug#

        public final void handleMessage(android.os.Message msg)

        handleMessage in class android.os.Handler

      • handleMessage

        public abstract void handleMessage(android.os.Message msg,
                                   T t)
        Must be implemented by subclasses in order to handle messages.
        Parameters:
        msg - The message.
        t - A strong reference to the object (usually an activity) which is guaranteed not to be null.
        See Also:
        Handler.handleMessage(Message)
